title: Semi San Serif?
content:
I apologize for the small image but this is all that I have. I know that I have seen this typeface before but can't seem to identify it. Any help would be much appreciated!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725070123im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20Shot%202014-06-27%20at%204_4706.34.06%20PM.png)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Screen Shot 2014-06-27 at 4.34.06 PM.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725070123/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20Shot%202014-06-27%20at%204.34.06%20PM.png) | 9.91 KB |
author: bobmarley65

comments.content: It looks like a manually slanted **[Agfa Rotis Semi Serif (Bold)](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725070123/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Agfa&ffam=AgfaRotisSemiSerif%20-%20Bold&fid=8ee8a2b5ac07dcd63b091e4abd3b248a&fstyle=i&fsize=60&text=CREDIT&wrap=2)** by Otl Aicher [1988], now available as Rotis Semi Serif from Monotype (after Agfa acquisition from Monotype Imaging) and also from Adobe or Linotype
